title: FBI joins probe into body found at Tesuque Pueblo
title_page: FBI joins probe into body found at Tesuque Pueblo
maintext:
The Bureau of Indian Affairs and FBI are investigating the discovery of a body Thursday afternoon on Tesuque Pueblo.
Tammy Peter, an acting spokeswoman for the FBI, identified the body as an adult but said she could not provide additional information while the investigation is ongoing.
Juan Ríos, spokesman for the Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office, said deputies were sent to the entrance of Tesuque Pueblo in response to a call about a body around 4 p.m. Thursday.
Ríos said the investigation is being handled by the Bureau of Indian Affairs because the sheriff’s office does not have jurisdiction on pueblo land.
Representatives of the Bureau of Indian Affairs said they couldn’t provide further details Friday evening.
Tesuque Pueblo Tribal Police referred questions about the investigation to the office of the pueblo governor on Friday morning. The governor could not immediately be reached for comment.
